title: What's so bad about Frozen Mallet?
body: So many people says it sucks now but I still reckon it's pree good (but could be a tad cheaper)

replies.body:
The {{item:3022}} itself is awesome.

What's Not awesome are the cost and its build path.

As an item it is awesome, gives great stats and has an excellent passive.

However for most games it's not viable because of it's cost.
It's too expensive to be rushed in the early to mid game, where it would be most effective. However as a late game item it still provides plenty of usable health and AD, but you wont make much use of it's passive in the late game.
it's a bit expensive but it's a good but on bruisers like riven and brolaf as a 5th or 6th item but because of the cost i'd usually just get warmogs then sell it and upgrade it later
It's stats are so indecisive and too expensive all for a slow

If you're not a tank It's stats are horrible, if you are a tank it's passive is horrible. It's a good buy if you've got a Runaan's Hurricane AND you're already ahead, but because you've already got a Runaan's Hurricane there's no way you're ahead.

n.b. Tankmo excluded, if you're playing Tankmo, this item is core. . . and I hope you die.

in part its because of the build path.
but for the most part is the mobility meta. slows dont stop dashes/flashes.

overall its a good item, but it just doesnt have a champ/subset of champs that it fits well with in the meta.
for raw HP warmogs is much better. for combat stat/tankyness sunfire omen TF IBG all do a similar job but better (omen combat stats are engage slow potential which is what FM does)
RG again is another item in the subset of FM and its infinitely OP/broken.
for slowing potential/chase, IBG Omen TF and RG are all better.
for slowing escape/kiting, IBG and TF are better.
